data.title: Great food….
data.text: We enjoyed dinner with friends at the restaurant.  The food and drink was very good, as well as the service!  You will not go wrong with dining here.  Parking can be challenging!!!

data.title: Everything was Perfect except the Salmon
data.text:
We had a Great table outside
Our server was very personable and fun
Our drinks were
Sweet and delicious 
The octopus was 
Wonderful!
The salmon slab on the salad wasn't tasty
I thought that the daily special was suppose to be
Good?!

data.title: Greek Well Served
data.text: Excellent gyros, one of the best I've had. Had the tabouli that is more parsley than bulgar making it very refreshing and tasty. Eating outside is fun especially when accommodating our dog who got his own water bowl!

data.title: Best Place for Greek
data.text: Wonderful menu, great flavorful food.  The Acropolis Salad is the best!  Lunch or dinner, can't go wrong.

data.title: Fantastic Greek Food and Restaurant
data.text: A friend took me here for dinner before a baseball game.  I really liked this place it was super.  Food was perfect, service was outstanding, what more could one ask for.  Server was sharp and on the ball.  Food came out promptly and server kept tabs on us to make sure we did not need a thing.  Definitely recommend.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: Stopped here after a visit to Musuem of Modern Art in Folk Art Museum in St Petersburg.  This was a day visit to the area and late in the afternoon we were hungry.  Happened upon the Acropoli Greek Taverna and decided to have a meal.  We were not disappointed.  My husband ordered a shrimp wrap sandwich and I ordered the pork souvlaki.  My husband raved about the shrimp wrap.  He thought the shrimp was very fresh, and the wrap itself was substantial with lots of fixings.  My souvlaki platter included a salad and fries.  Loved the salad which had a nice piece of feta cheese on top - Mmmmmm - but the skewered pork was a bit overcooked which rendered the meat a bit on the tough side.  Thought the fries were good.  We arrived at a time of day when beer was 1/2 price so my husband ordered Yuengling at a cost of $2 each for a total of $4.  When I looked at the bill, my ice tea at $2.50 was more expensive than his beer!!!  Our waiter was attentive and friendly.  Would recommend!!

data.title: Craving a Gyro...
data.text: It has been a while since we visited Acropolis only because I had bariatric surgery 6 months ago.  The food was fantastic as always.  We had the calamari to start...oh so tender and full of flavor!  And of course we had their Gyros.  Because of my surgery, I am limited with the amount of food I can eat.  I have started carrying a medical card stating such.  It was great being able to order off the child's menu...as I can't even eat half of a child's portion.  The gyros were so full of flavor, tender and delicious!  The waitress was fairly new.  She was very pleasant/friendly.  She never hesitated when asked for anything.  The night we went (Saturday), they had a musician playing Greek music and a belly dancer.  My kids were thrilled!  The belly dancer was very interactive with the patrons, making her way around the entire restaurant.  We had a great evening!

data.title: Pleasantly Surprised
data.text: We were in town to see the Holocaust Museum, roam a Central Avenue arts fair and end the day at the Tropicana for a ball game. A very pleasant day. Became hot outside though so we ducked into the Acropolis to cool off and have a bite. Pleasant inside and we decided to take seats at the bar. The bartender was nicely attentive. My wife ordered a falafel wrap with a lead in side salad and I kept it simple with their grilled octopus appetizer. My wife enjoyed her side salad and the dressing it came with on the side. She also prides herself on being a falafel connoisseur...and knows the good from the much less good. She found the Acropolis falafel in its wrap to be especially well seasoned and gave it high marks. But, even that was out done by the grilled octopus. Well grilled, not overly chewy and especially well seasoned. The chef knows his/her seasonings/spices. Hours later my wife was still commenting on how good her meal was, especially the delightful octopus. Kudos to the Acropolis,

data.title: Great service!
data.text: Love the second floor outside setting! Sonya , our waitress made us feel welcome, helped with an order and gave us absolutely excellent service, that makes us want to come back. Belly dancer came to the balcony also, it's Saturday evening. Wine was good, appetizers tasty. I had eggplant, I liked it OK. My husband had gyro wrap, he liked it.

data.title: Great food on restaurant week--servers need some work
data.text: We decided to go to the Acropolis during Restaurant Week.  When we arrived, I asked the hostess for the Restaurant Week Menu--she didn't know what I was talking about.  At least she went to get someone to help.  They didn't know either.  Finally, they found someone who knew what I was talking about and they brought the special menu.  We were upset that we had to work so hard just to get the menu.  However, we ordered and the food and service were great after that.  This place has good food, but they need to work on their communication.  Why bother to be involved with Restaurant Week if you are not going to inform your staff?  I rated them very good only because we enjoyed the food so much--but the servers lack of knowledge actually should have lowered them to poor.

data.title: Great place to eat, you feel like you are in Greece
data.text: The Lemon Chicken soup and the gyros well just about everything they offer is great.  It is a great dining experience from the wait staff to the hostess to the fun dancing performed by the staff.  The food is excellent and you can even take your doggy and sit outside and enjoy a great meal on Central Avenue.  It is a short walk from Beach Blvd up Central and you won't be sorry you made the walk.

data.title: Disappointing Food - Several Times
data.text:
Over the last 2 years or so I've had three bad experiences with the food served by Acropolis Greek Taverna on Central Ave in St. Petersburg, Florida. My last experience was especially bad, because both my food and my friend's food were entirely unacceptable. My dish had way too much salt (I don't think they rinsed the capers, is my guess for the reason). My friend's chicken was way overdone, and she did not enjoy her meal at all.

Many people apparently enjoy this restaurant, so I'm sure it's not all bad. But I have to play the odds in my favor, and my experiences indicate the odds of having a great meal there are not good.

data.title: A treat for me and my grandchildren, too!
data.text: My 6 and 7 year old granddaughters and their parents took me out to dinner.  I had trout with a light sauce, roasted vegetables and orzo.  I took half of mine home and nuked it.  It was almost as delicious as the first night.  A bosouki player entertained us a while, then all the servers danced arm-in-arm and threw white napkins up in the air, everywhere.  the kids loved it.  My son had shish ke bab which he thought was cooked perfectly.  The girls cleaned their plates, so that tells it all.  Reasonably priced and worth every penny.

data.title: Very poor excuse for a Greek restaurant.
data.text: Servers do not know what is Greek food from a McDonalds hamburger.You ask for a cheese spread and they bring you crummy  cheese that  comes out from a box, they soaked in oil and they serve it to you.3/4 of their dinners are anything but Greek, they try to confuse you with a belly dancer that could be anything but most likely a go go dancer from the 60. They are way over priced and the dinners are very small you might as well go to MaDonalds after that. NEVER AGAIN

data.title: Fits Into My Healthy Lifestyle
data.text: As the author of "Goodbye Fatness, Hello Gorgeous!", I am always looking to dine at places that will help me stay on track with my healthy lifestyle.  This is the place! I had a nice chicken with lemon dish that was amazing! The spinach and orzo was incredible. Great service and great recommendations!

data.title: Great for a Large Group!  Fun place!
data.text: Met here for a 40th birthday dinner...we sat upstairs which allowed us to all sit together and it was perfect!  We still experienced the dancing and music but was still able to socialize.  They served the 25+ of us promptly and I believe all meals were delivered as ordered!  Good food and was reasonably priced.

data.title: Fine Food, But Will Not Be High on My List
data.text: I like Greek food, but it seems my only favorite is a Gyro and Saganaki. All the other items are standard fare elsewhere such as crab cakes,fried fish, and an assortment of breakfast items. The food was good, but nothing extraordinary. Service was very odd in that our waiter appeared and took a beverage order. Someone else delivered the drink order and after another ten minutes of this server taking other orders from later arrivals we asked for the check.

data.title: Good Greek food - reasonable prices
data.text: Lunch visit- so we lost the atmosphere but very good meals.   Gyro salads, chicken salads and gyro platter all delicious - about $12 each.  Generous portions. Saganaki delicious but poor presentation - felt cheated out of our OPA's !       Service attentive - but too pushy to pull our plates and box up leftovers while we were still eating and enjoying our meal 😕

data.title: Food good, service terrible.
data.text:
This was our first visit and unfortunately the service was horrible.  It will be a long time before we try it again.  

It started off fine, we were seated immediately, brought water and ordered drinks.  It was happy hour so we both ordered a glass of house wine.  The waiter came and took our order.  The appetizer (eggplant rolls) came out fairly quickly and it was really good.  The waiter said bread would be ready in 2 minutes.  Then our main course was brought to us by a runner and it also was good.  Note, the bread never made it to our table.

We never saw the waiter after he brought us the appetizer until it was time to bring the bill.  No one asked if our food was okay, if we needed anything, would like another glass of wine, nothing.  

I was extremely disappointed especially since we just got back from being in Greece 2 weeks ago and would have loved to find a nice place to get Greek food.  I guess we will be trying other restaurants in the area

data.title: Best Greek Food in Florida!!
data.text: Fantastic food, service and atmosphere. We love the dancing wait staff, the napkin toss, and the smashing of the plates!! It was an amazing surprise and very entertaining.  My husband and I love the food and go here every time we are in the area.
